Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulation

  • public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
    The simulator. This tracks the elements in a grid and coordinates that with the display.
    Author:
    Dave Feinberg, K. Raven Russell, and Corey Jones

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INIT_COLS
      The default number of columns the grid should have.
      static int INIT_ROWS
      The default number of rows the grid should have.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulation(boolean withDisplay)
      Sets up the instance variables (grid and display).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DynamicArray<DynamicArray<Element>> getGrid()
      Convenience method for GTA testing.
      void locationClicked(int row, int col, Element newElem)
      This is called when the user clicks on a location using the given tool.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method that kicks off the simulator.
      static java.lang.String newElementPost()
      Indicates the private post where you have shown off your new element(s).
      boolean resize(int numRows, int numCols)
      Resizes the grid (if needed) to a bigger or smaller size.
      void run()
      Game loop of the program (step, redraw, handlers, etc.).
      void step()
      Causes one random particle to maybe do something.
      void updateDisplay()
      Copies each element of grid's color into the display.

        The default number of columns the grid should have.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(boolean withDisplay)
        Sets up the instance variables (grid and display).
        Parameters:
        withDisplay - whether or not the display should be created (for testing purposes)

    • Method Detail

      • locationClicked

        public void locationClicked(int row,
                            int col,
                            Element newElem)
        This is called when the user clicks on a location using the given tool.
        Parameters:
        row - the row where the action happened
        col - the column where the action happened
        newElem - the element the user has created to put there

      • updateDisplay

        public void updateDisplay()
        Copies each element of grid's color into the display.

      • resize

        public boolean resize(int numRows,
                      int numCols)
        Resizes the grid (if needed) to a bigger or smaller size.
        Parameters:
        numRows - the new number of rows the grid should have
        numCols - the new number of columns the grid should have
        Returns:
        whether or not anything was changed

      • newElementPost

        public static java.lang.String newElementPost()
        Indicates the private post where you have shown off your new element(s).
        Returns:
        the post where you describe your new element

      • step

        public void step()
        Causes one random particle to maybe do something. Called repeatedly.

      • run

        public void run()
        Game loop of the program (step, redraw, handlers, etc.).

      • getGrid

        public DynamicArray<DynamicArray<Element>> getGrid()
        Convenience method for GTA testing. Do not use this in your code... for testing purposes only.
        Returns:
        the private grid element

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method that kicks off the simulator.
        Parameters:
        args - not used
